Now, the C code structure:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main() {
    // Read first part's inputs
    int n, m;
    scanf("%d %d", &n, &m);
    
    int *req = malloc(n * sizeof(int));
    int *pre = malloc(m * sizeof(int));
    
    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
        scanf("%d", &req[i]);
    }
    for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
        scanf("%d", &pre[i]);
    }
    
    // Process first part
    int i = n-1, j = m-1;
    int ans1 = 0;
    while (i >=0 && j >=0) {
        if (req[i] > pre[j]) {
            ans1++;
        } else {
            j--;
        }
        i--;
    }
    int val1 = ans1 + i +1;
    
    // Process second part
    long long val2 = 0;
    for (int i =1; i <= val1; i++) {
        long long d = val1 / i;
        val2 += (long long)i * d * (d+1) /2;
    }
    
    // Process third part
    int K = val2;
    int result;
    if (K %2 ==0 || K%5 ==0) {
        result = -1;
    } else {
        if (K %7 ==0) {
            K /=7;
        }
        K *=9;
        int ans =1;
        int remainder =10 % K;
        while (remainder !=1) {
            ans++;
            remainder = (remainder *10) % K;
        }
        result = ans;
    }
    
    // Output the result
    printf("%d\n", result);
    
    free(req);
    free(pre);
    return 0;
}
